DataElement.preferredName: Person Radiation Therapy Discontinued Greater Than or Equal To 2 Week Prior Enrollment Yes No Not Applicable Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Text term to signify whether a patient has completed radiation therapy at least two weeks prior to enrollment in a clinical trial.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Person Radiation Therapy Discontinued Greater Than or Equal To 2 Week Prior Enrollment
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to a person having discontinued any treatment of a disease by means of exposure of the target or the whole body to radiation prior to registration as an element of a personal medical history which is necessary to allow an individual to participate in a specific clinical trial._A statement about the relative size or order of two objects specifying that either both objects are the same in quantity or measure or value or status or that the object of interest exceeds the other object in one of these ways._A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.::2_Any period of seven consecutive days._Earlier in time or order. (NCI)_The act of registration, entering in a list, catalog, group, study; also, the number of subjects enrolled.

Property.preferredName: Radiation Therapy Discontinue Prior Registration Greater Than or Equal To Integer::2 Week Prior Enrollment
Property.preferredDefinition: Treatment of a disease by means of exposure of the target or the whole body to radiation. Radiation therapy is often used as part of curative therapy and occasionally as a component of palliative treatment for cancer. Other uses include total body irradiation prior to transplantation.:To stop or end, permanently or temporarily.:Earlier in time or order.:The act of listing or recording officially; officially qualified or enrolled.:A statement about the relative size or order of two objects specifying that either both objects are the same in quantity or measure or value or status or that the object of interest exceeds the other object in one of these ways.:A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.::2:Any period of seven consecutive days.:Earlier in time or order.:The act of registration, entering in a list, catalog, group, study; also, the number of subjects enrolled.

Concepts.definition: Treatment of a disease by means of exposure of the target or the whole body to radiation. Radiation therapy is often used as part of curative therapy and occasionally as a component of palliative treatment for cancer. Other uses include total body irradiation prior to transplantation.
To stop or end, permanently or temporarily.
The act of listing or recording officially; officially qualified or enrolled.

A statement about the relative size or order of two objects specifying that either both objects are the same in quantity or measure or value or status or that the object of interest exceeds the other object in one of these ways.
A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.
Any period of seven consecutive days.
The act of registration, entering in a list, catalog, group, study; also, the number of subjects enrolled.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no/not applicable.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

Concepts.definition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2022.12.28 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0001837. aj

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A response or indicator that can have a value of yes, no, or not applicable.

Concepts.longName: Yes, No, or Not Applicable Response
Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of yes, no, or not applicable.

RepresentationTerm.changeDescription: 10.2.20 TL changed WFS from RETIRED PHASED OUT to RETIRED ARCHIVED. Retired DBW 04-27-2016 per Tina Taylor approved by Dianne Reves

ValueDomain.changeDescription: 3/12/17 jk added Standard reg status; ownership transfered from CTEP to NCI Standards with concurrence of CTEP/Brian Campbell. 8/3/2015 Corrections made to VD in order to restore to original format: removed C49486 as rep term and replaced with C49797; restored long name and definition per Dianne Reeves/tt.

ReferenceDocuments.name: CITN-1
ReferenceDocuments.description: >=2 weeks from completing prior local radiation therapy.
